dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 1234 IH: Can’t Cancel Your Own Debt Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Cole (for himself, Mr. Babin, Mrs. Bice, Mr. Bost, Mr. Burgess, Mr. Calvert, Mr. Guthrie, Mrs. Hinson, Mr. Johnson of South Dakota, Ms. Letlow, Mr. Norman, Mr. Reschenthaler, Ms. Van Duyne, Mr. Womack, Mr. Carey, and Mr. Cloud) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To prohibit Members of Congress from receiving a financial benefit from certain student loan cancellation programs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Can’t Cancel Your Own Debt Act of 2023.

section.header: No student loan cancellation for Members of Congress

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, an individual who serves as a Member of Congress shall not be eligible, during or after such service—

paragraph.text: for any service- or employment-based student loan cancellation for any time served as a Member of Congress; or

for student loan cancellation from any Federal program that is established or amended by an Act of Congress, or established or set forth by an Executive order or agency action, during the period in which the individual is serving as a Member.

subsection.text: For the purposes of this Act—

paragraph.text: The term agency action has the meaning given such term in section 551 of title 5, United States Code.
The term cancellation means cancellation, forgiveness, or assumption of the obligation to repay the student loan debt of an individual by the Federal Government.

The term student loan means any loan made to an individual (including a loan made to a parent on behalf of a dependent student) for expenses related to attendance or enrollment at an institution of higher education.

subsection.text: This Act shall apply to any individual who serves as a Member of Congress on or after the date of enactment of this Act.
